title.narrative: ED IR4.1: MULTICOUNTRYQUALITY PRIMARY ED

description.narrative: ED Programme Component Results (PCR) 4 Intermediate Results (IR) 4.1: By 2017 children in Pacific Island Countries including those living with disabilities in targeted areas benefit from increased enrolment and retention rates as well as from improved literacy & numeracy outcomes, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ED Programme Component Results (PCR) 4: By 2017, an increased percentage of girls and boys access schools that uphold minimum national quality standards and support student achievement to the end of the primary cycle in at least 4 Pacific Island Countries.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ED PCR 4 IR 4.1: By 2017 children in Pacific Island Countries including those living with disabilities in targeted areas benefitfrom increased enrolment and retention rates as well as from improved literacy & numeracy outcomes

description.narrative: Four Pacific Island Countries have strengthened resiliency and increased capacity to address disruptions to children learning during emergencies by carrying out disaster risk reduction activities that help them prepare for and respond to education in emergencies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/07/2017

title.narrative: Number of PICs with endorsed National Minimum Quality Service Standards (NMQSS) for Primary Education.

target.value: 2015:4 PICs (Kiribati, Solomon Islands, Tuvalu and Vanuatu)

actual.value: 2016:Completed, with the official endorsement of the Tuvalu minimum quality service standards for schools four countries (Kiribati, Solomon Islands, Tuvalu and Vanuatu) now have officially endorsed these standards
